revised_title: Gravitational Perturbations of Kerr Black Holes
tldr: This article explores the gravitational perturbations of Kerr black holes, focusing on the perturbations in the quantities that vanish in the stationary state. The author analyzes the spin coefficients and components of the Weyl tensor using the Newman-Penrose formalism and derives equations for the perturbations. The study aims to provide a foundation for understanding the behavior of black holes under perturbations and the effects of gravitational waves.
